info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 16 at 4:56PM HST until January 17 at 12:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MIDNIGHT HST FOR INTERIOR AND WINDWARD KAUAI AND OAHU... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE HIGHEST SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND AND MOUNT HALEAKALA ON MAUI... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR NIIHAU MOLOKAI LANAI REMAINING PORTIONS OF OAHU AND KAUAI AND FOR THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .Strong southwest winds will continue through this evening with gusts up to 60 mph possible on portions of Kauai and Oahu as a cold front approaches the area from the west. Strong southwest winds on the summits of the Big Island and Haleakala Summit will continue through Wednesday. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT HST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph. * WHERE...Niihau, Molokai, Lanai, portions of Kauai and Oahu, and the lower elevations of Maui and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until midnight HST tonight. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
